summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from whistleblower Christopher Dilorio to SEC officials, primarily Janey, appealing a preliminary denial of his whistleblower award claim. Dilorio alleges extensive SEC corruption, obstruction, and active facilitation of securities fraud, money laundering, and market manipulation involving numerous shell companies, individuals linked to Trump, Epstein, and Russian interests, and the broker-dealer Knight Capital (NITE/KCG/VIRT).

persons.name: Christopher Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, appealing a preliminary denial of his SEC whistleblower award claim and alleging widespread SEC corruption and facilitation of fraud.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: SEC recipient of Dilorio's emails; accused of not distributing his information and being part of the obstruction.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Trump PA Campaign Manager, Board Director
persons.context: Named as being on the board of NITE and FSD Pharma (HUGE), linked to Trump and alleged money laundering shells.

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.context: Described as a prolific 'Bag Man' and largest shareholder of SkyWay, later CEO of Blink Charging (BLNK), a alleged money laundering shell.

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.context: Identified as a Trump fundraiser and business partner of Jeffrey Epstein, linked to fraud in BLNK.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a business partner of Jonathan Farkas and linked to Bill Richardson and the Zorro Ranch in New Mexico.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his New Mexico Zorro Ranch, and mentioned in connection with BLNK.

persons.name: Clayton
persons.context: SEC Chair (Jay Clayton) accused of undisclosed conflicts related to Sullivan & Cromwell and NITE, and of facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Colleague of Clayton at Sullivan & Cromwell, accused of playing a key role in keeping NITE operational.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.role: SEC Official (likely Office of the Whistleblower)
persons.context: SEC official (likely from OWB) repeatedly addressed in emails, accused of being part of the corrupt obstruction.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: Another SEC official addressed in the emails.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Described as a 'Bag Man' with JMJ, barred by FINRA but allegedly kept operating with SEC facilitation, involved with BLNK and other shells.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Named as a 'Bag Man' involved with Hanover/Magna and multiple shell companies (CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, etc.), subject of an SEC complaint.

persons.name: Oleg Firer
persons.context: Described as a prolific 'Bag Man', linked to Acies Corp., Allied Wallet, WireCard, and Jaclin-related entities.

persons.name: Bill Scigliano
persons.context: Chairman of the Board for Acies Corp. and a director at BLNK, linked to money laundering shells.

persons.name: Engel
persons.context: Board member of BLNK with a background at Drexel, linked to Milken.

persons.name: New
persons.context: CFO from Net Element (NETE) who became CFO at BLNK, linked to money laundering allegations.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Linked to the Jaclin money laundering shell PRComplete/YESDtc and subject of an SEC complaint (Frost, Honig, et al.).

persons.name: Nordlicht
persons.context: Linked to Platinum Funds and involved in Car Charging Inc. (predecessor to BLNK), with links to Kushner and Trump lawyer Giuliani.

persons.name: Crede
persons.context: Linked to Net Element (NETE) fraud and offerings with Esousa and Cobblestone, connected to Milken/Putin interests.

persons.name: Peizer
persons.context: Linked to Net Element (NETE) fraud and offerings with Esousa and Cobblestone.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, which was subject to an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump promotion of NETE.

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, subject to SEC complaint.

persons.name: McKessy
persons.context: Former SEC Office of the Whistleblower chief, noted as being in possession of Dilorio's 2013 TCR.

persons.name: Berger
persons.context: SEC official with whom Dilorio filed a 2013 TCR.

connections.description: Dilorio is the whistleblower submitting allegations and appeals to SEC official Janey, whom he accuses of obstruction and not distributing his information.
Jonathan Farkas is identified as a business partner of Jeffrey Epstein.
Jonathan Farkas is described as a Trump fundraiser.
Implied familial or business relationship; both are labeled 'Bag Men' and linked to fraud schemes.
Bill Richardson is linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his Zorro Ranch in New Mexico.
Both are colleagues from Sullivan & Cromwell, implicated in protecting NITE.
Clayton is accused of having undisclosed conflicts and facilitating the ongoing operation of the alleged criminal entity NITE.
Keener is associated with JMJ, involved in multiple alleged money laundering shells.
Sason is linked to Hanover/Magna and numerous shell companies.
Firer is linked to Jaclin-related entities and money laundering shells.
Engel is a Drexel flunkie linked to Milken.
Nordlicht (Platinum Funds) has links to Kushner(s).
Crede is linked to Milken/Putin interests in the context of the NETE fraud.
Brothers and co-founders of SeeThroughEquity, involved in pump-and-dump of NETE.

events.title: Dilorio's Formal Appeal Email
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sends an email with the subject 'Formal appeal for preliminary denial covered action 2015-016/ Knight TCR & Appendix', attaching documents and alleging new evidence of SEC corruption.

events.title: BLNK Press Release and Stock Pump
events.description: Blink Charging (BLNK) issues a press release about a grant for charging stations, driving the stock up ~30% without filing a required SEC 8-K form, alleged by Dilorio to be a fraudulent pump-and-dump.

events.title: SEC Approval of BLNK Public Offering
events.description: The SEC declares effective a public offering of securities for BLNK, which Dilorio alleges was approved despite his overwhelming whistleblower evidence of fraud.

events.title: Knight Capital 'Glitch'
events.description: Knight Capital Group suffers a massive trading 'glitch' that collapses its stock price, mentioned in the context of Blackstone's interest and alleged orchestration.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThroughEquity
events.description: The SEC files a complaint against SeeThroughEquity, LLC and the Tandon brothers for pump-and-dump schemes, which Dilorio notes involved promoting Net Element (NETE).

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener/JMJ
events.description: FINRA bars Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' for anti-money laundering violations and failure to cooperate, but Dilorio alleges the SEC kept him operating.

events.title: SEC Jaclin 'Shell Factory' Complaint
events.description: The SEC files a complaint against Jaclin et al. for operating a 'shell factory', which included New Image Concepts (later BLNK).

locations: Virginia, Maryland, DC (Mid-Atlantic region for BLNK stations)
keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher Dilorio, alleges the SEC is a 'criminal organization' that actively facilitates money laundering, securities fraud, and market manipulation while obstructing his whistleblower claims.
Multiple individuals are linked to Jeffrey Epstein, including Jonathan Farkas (business partner) and ex-Governor Bill Richardson (linked to Epstein's Zorro Ranch).

The broker-dealer Knight Capital (NITE/KCG/VIRT) is accused of being a central criminal entity engaged in 'abusive naked shorting' of publicly traded shells to facilitate money laundering, with SEC protection.

Several shell companies are named as vehicles for fraud, including Blink Charging (BLNK fka New Image Concepts), Net Element (NETE), FSD Pharma (HUGE), and others linked to individuals in Trump's orbit (e.g., David Urban, Jonathan Farkas).

SEC Chair Jay Clayton is accused of undisclosed conflicts due to his former firm Sullivan & Cromwell's ties to NITE and of facilitating fraud, with calls for his immediate resignation and a criminal investigation.
